main event: Several fiery colored objects were observed traveling in a southerly direction in Fontana, California, by 1st Lt Ralph R. Scouten during a routine training mission.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be about 6 inches to 1 foot in diameter,The observation lasted approximately 15 minutes,The objects traveled at a high estimated speed of 1500 mph at an altitude of 7000 feet,There was no physical evidence or photographs taken,The maneuvering of the objects was described as erratic and they seemed to engage with the observer.
witness description: 1st Lt Ralph R. Scouten, U.S. Air Force
